brainly_data.question: Cells in organisms need food,air,and waste removal. how are these met? a) organs and tissues perform these functions for cells. b) cells share their waste with other cells. c)each cell must specialize in all of these functions d) cells get their food from the air and sunlight around them
brainly_data.subject: Biology

all_answers.question: Cells in organisms need food,air,and waste removal. how are these met? a) organs and tissues perform these functions for cells. b) cells share their waste with other cells. c)each cell must specialize in all of these functions d) cells get their food from the air and sunlight around them
all_answers.subject: Biology
all_answers.text: I think that correct answer from the choices listed above is the first option. Cells in organisms are able to met the said needs since they have organs and tissues that perform these functions for the cells.
